Research Libraries and Technology .A Fussler, H.H. The focus of the report is primarily upon the problems of the large, university, research-oriented library.  It is here that one finds the most difficult resource-access and bibliographical control problems.  If one can significantly improve both of these operations for the large, research-oriented institutions, there are likely to be direct or indirect benefits for the smaller library, while the reverse situation is much less likely. .X 5	1	1257 10	1	1257 115	1	1257 141	1	1257 172	1	1257 190	1	1257 225	1	1257 234	1	1257 244	2	1257 245	1	1257 249	1	1257 250	1	1257 295	1	1257 299	1	1257 304	1	1257 305	1	1257 306	1	1257 358	1	1257 364	1	1257 365	3	1257 385	1	1257 394	2	1257 433	1	1257 453	1	1257 459	1	1257 529	1	1257 534	1	1257 630	1	1257 652	1	1257 702	1	1257 731	1	1257 732	1	1257 764	1	1257 811	1	1257 816	1	1257 817	1	1257 818	1	1257 820	1	1257 822	1	1257 823	2	1257 825	2	1257 826	1	1257 827	1	1257 828	1	1257 842	1	1257 854	1	1257 856	1	1257 871	1	1257 872	2	1257 873	1	1257 874	1	1257 875	1	1257 876	1	1257 877	1	1257 878	1	1257 879	1	1257 880	1	1257 886	2	1257 888	1	1257 892	1	1257 913	1	1257 925	1	1257 940	1	1257 941	1	1257 943	1	1257 944	1	1257 947	1	1257 948	2	1257 963	1	1257 981	1	1257 990	1	1257 994	1	1257 997	1	1257 998	1	1257 1004	1	1257 1017	1	1257 1023	1	1257 1058	1	1257 1079	1	1257 1143	1	1257 1146	1	1257 1230	2	1257 1247	1	1257 1257	13	1257 1258	1	1257 1303	1	1257 1390	2	1257 1396	1	1257 1410	1	1257 1433	1	1257 1435	1	1257 1436	1	1257 1441	1	1257 1441	1	1257
